wikipedia_page.main: Geraint Jennings (born 13 May 1966) is a Jersey politician and linguist.

response: Frank Le Maistre (1910–2002), compiler of the dictionary , maintained a literary output starting in the 1930s with newspaper articles under the pseudonym , poems, magazine articles, research into toponymy and etymology. Since Sir Arthur's death, a roster of contributors has maintained the tradition of the weekly (or fortnightly) newspaper column. Currently, the writer of this feature is Geraint Jennings.

Notable members have included Dr Robert Ranulph Marett, the leading early evolutionary anthropologist, whose father Robert Pipon Marett was a founder member; Dr Arthur Mourant FRS a noted haematologist and George Reginald Balleine historian and clergyman. Geraint Jennings, writer and politician, is also a member.

Les Pages Jèrriaises (English: The Jèrriais Pages) is a collection of thousands of pages in and about Jèrriais posted on the internet.  It was created and is maintained by Geraint Jennings.  It is the largest collection of Norman materials on the internet.  It has also been praised in Normandy as an example of how a Norman dialect has managed to modernise itself.Presse de la Manche 10/6/2001  Les Pages Jèrriaises have also featured prominently in a national newspaper.Jersey Evening Post 22/4/2000.

Les Pages Jèrriaises, commissioned by La Société Jersiaise, were initially created by Geraint Jennings, and had achieved media notice by 1996.Jersey Evening Post 2/12/1996  In 1999, a local contest was created to celebrate the addition of the 1,000th page.Jersey Evening Post 20/8/1999
In February 1999 he stood in a Senatorial by-election and was voted in with 3,320 votes (beating Paul Le Claire, Harry Cole and Geraint Jennings).
